inputs.name: selectedOption
inputs.label: Testcase Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of the test to execute.

inputs.name: projectdir
inputs.label: Project Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified path to HCL OneTest UI project directory. Use '\\' or '/' as the file separator. This path must exist on the agent.

inputs.name: testsuite
inputs.label: Test Suite Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the script to be executed without the extension. For eg., Script1 or TestFolder.Script1 in case Script1 is in a folder named TestFolder.

inputs.name: logformat
inputs.label: Log Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: The format of the script logs.

inputs.name: workspace
inputs.label: Workspace Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The complete path to the Eclipse workspace, required if Config File is not specified

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of a project within the workspace to use, required if Config File is not specified

inputs.name: suite
inputs.label: Test Suite Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of a test within the project to use. A test can be WebUI test, Compound test, Performance schedule or Accelerated Functional Test (AFT) suite, required if Config File is not specified

inputs.name: imshared
inputs.label: IMShared Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the IMShared folder in your local installation, if it is not at default location. This is where plugins and product dependencies will be located by the execution agent.

inputs.name: configfile
inputs.label: Configuration File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to specify the complete path to a file that contains the parameters for a test run

inputs.name: swapdatasets
inputs.label: Dataset Override
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to replace dataset values during a test or schedule run. You must ensure that both original and new datasets are in the same workspace and have the same column names. You must also include the path to the dataset. For example, /project_name/ds_path/ds_filename.csv:/project_name/ds_path/new_ds_filename.csv

inputs.name: exportreport
inputs.label: Export Report
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to export the unified report to any of the formats - PDF, XML or HTML. For example, to export the report to only the pdf format, you can input: type=unified;format=pdf;folder=path;filename=testreport. If you want to export the report to multiple formats, you can specify the file formats as comma-separated values.

inputs.name: itercount
inputs.label: Iteration Count
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of Dataset iterations to be run.

inputs.name: exportstats
inputs.label: Export Stats
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to export reports in comma-separated values (CSV) format

inputs.name: exportstatshtml
inputs.label: Export stats html
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option if you want to export web analytic results only. The results are exported in the specified directory. You can then analyze the results on a web browser without using the test workbench.

inputs.name: exportstatsformat
inputs.label: Export stats format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to set report type csv or json

inputs.name: exportstatreportlist
inputs.label: Export stat report list
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to specify a comma-separated list of report IDs along with exportstats or exportstatshtml to list the reports that you want to export in place of the default reports, or the reports selected under Preferences. To view this setting, navigate to Window > Preferences > Test > Performance Test Reports > Export Reports.To copy the report IDs list into your command line, navigate to Window > Preferences > Test > Performance Test Reports > Export Reports. UnderSelect reports to export, select the required reports, and click Copy ID to clipboard

inputs.name: imports
inputs.label: Import
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the Project location to be imported.

inputs.name: labels
inputs.label: Labels
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to add labels to test results. To add multiple labels to a test result, you must separate each label by using a comma.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines whether a results file with the same name is overwritten. The default value, false, indicates that the new results file is created. If the value is true, the file is overwritten and retains the same file name.

inputs.name: protocolinput
inputs.label: Protocol Input
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this parameter to run a UI test in parallel on different browsers, for example - all.available.targets.in.parallel=chrome,ff,ie

inputs.name: publish
inputs.label: Publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can use this parameter to publish test results to the Server

inputs.name: publish_for
inputs.label: Publish_for
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can use this option to publish the test results based on the completion status of the tests

inputs.name: publishreports
inputs.label: Publishreports
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can use this option to publish specific test results to the Server

inputs.name: results
inputs.label: Results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to specify the name of the results file. The default result file name is the test name with a time stamp appended. Specify a folder name that is relative to the project to store the test results. For example, -results folder/resultname

inputs.name: usercomments
inputs.label: User Comments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add text within double quotation mark to display it in the User Comments row of the report

inputs.name: varfile
inputs.label: Var File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The complete path to the XML file that contains the variable name and value pairs.

inputs.name: vmargs
inputs.label: VM Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: VM Arguments separated by (,)

inputs.name: azureServer
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Project URL
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify your Azure DevOps Project URL. For example https://hostname/{yourorganization}/{project}. 
The fields Azure DevOps Project URL, Azure DevOps PAT, Test Plan Name & Test Case Name are required to publish test results to the test case.

inputs.name: patToken
inputs.label: Azure DevOps PAT
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify your Azure DevOps Personal Access Token. Optionally, you can add your token to a secret variable and specify the variable name in the form $(your variable name). [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/variables?view=azure-devops&tabs=classic%2Cbatch#secret-variables)

inputs.name: testPlanName
inputs.label: Test Plan Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test Plan name from the corresponding Azure DevOps Project.

inputs.name: testCaseName
inputs.label: Test Case Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test Case name from the corresponding Test Plan.

inputs.name: userargs
inputs.label: User Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional playback arguments, if any.
